title: Issues sourcing setup-env.sh on macOS
body:
All, I'm coming back to trying `spack` after a long time away with a goal to getting a working ESMF build for GEOS, a model I help maintain, after attending some SC18 sessions. All the new features look amazing!

So, before, I was using `spack` with `tcsh` and I even contributed some code for the `setup-env.csh` script. But I've migrated to use `bash` on my macOS laptop because `bash` is infinitely better. However, I seem to be stuck at, oh, the second step of installation after cloning. My guess is it's due to my current macOS + Homebrew + lmod setup, but I'm not sure what I did.  My prompt? I'm baffled. To wit:

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
[mathomp4:~/spack] develop 3m30s ± . share/spack/setup-env.sh
usage: dirname path
usage: dirname path
bash: total: No such file or directory
```

Well, that's not great. But I've [seen issues like that on macOS before](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1308823/os-x-bash-dirname). So, my first thought is I should try using GNU `dirname` instead of the macOS BSD `dirname`. I link the `gdirname` from Homebrew into `~/bin/dirname` and:

```console
[mathomp4:~/spack] develop 3m1s ± . share/spack/setup-env.sh
dirname: invalid option -- 'r'
Try 'dirname --help' for more information.
dirname: missing operand
Try 'dirname --help' for more information.
bash: total: No such file or directory
```
Well, nuts. Obviously I've done something very bad to my bash environment, but I'm not sure what. Any ideas?


### Information on your system

OS: macOS 10.13.6
Shell: bash GNU bash, version 4.4.23(1)-release

Also: I moved away my (I'm guessing) old `.spack` directory which had `packages.yaml` and `modules.yaml` just in case it was the issue.
